page.title: 11EDUCATION
page.content: The school in the village of Clipston is a very important part of the community, and has been so for three hundred years. It has however, been completely modernised with a hall and library extension built on the back of the original building. When it was first built in 1667 it was used as a Hospital and School combined, but in this century has only been used for education. There are five classes at the moment, and the number of children on role is 120 approximately. As well as the five teaching staff, there is a music specialist who visits the school each week to give the children singing and recorder lessons. The school buildings are also used in the evenings for other activities, such as Brownies, Guides, Evening Classes and general meetings.
